details:
Problem Description:
====================

In some cases, the ktrace facility will log the contents of
kernel structures to userspace. In one such case, ktrace dumps a
variable-sized sockaddr to userspace. There, the full sockaddr is
copied, even when it is shorter than the full size. This can result
in up to 14 uninitialized bytes of kernel memory being copied out
to userspace.

Impact:
=======

It is possible for an unprivileged userspace program to leak
14 bytes of a kernel heap allocation to userspace.
summary: FreeBSD -- Uninitialized kernel memory disclosure via ktrace(2)
